question_text: What does the word "muffles" mean in paragraph 3?
options: changes to a slow speed
moves to a new stage
causes things to get darker
makes things difficult to notice

passage: pdfData:pdf/2025 NYS Grade 4 English Language Arts Test Released Questions.pdf
question_text: What is a central idea of the section "All Through the Night..."?
options: Falling asleep takes less than thirty minutes for most people.
Odd feelings while falling asleep are normal.
Time passes differently while falling asleep.
Falling asleep is an experience that involves the whole body.

passage: pdfData:pdf/2025 NYS Grade 4 English Language Arts Test Released Questions.pdf
question_text: Which detail best expresses a claim the author makes about sleep?
options: "Sleep is so useful that all animals do it. And without it, waking life would be impossible." (paragraph 2)
"As you slip into sleep, your heart slows down and you breathe more slowly." (paragraph 4)
"During deep sleep, long, slow waves of electrical impulses move through the brain." (paragraph 7)
"In the next stage of sleep, your muscles go completely slack. Your body doesn't move at all." (paragraph 8)

passage: pdfData:pdf/2025 NYS Grade 4 English Language Arts Test Released Questions.pdf
question_text: Based on the article, how does REM sleep help people?
options: The eyes move back and forth while they are closed.
The brain links experiences and memories.
People can begin having strange dreams.
People sleep more deeply when it is almost morning.

passage: pdfData:pdf/2025 NYS Grade 4 English Language Arts Test Released Questions.pdf
question_text: How does the author organize the information in paragraph 14?
options: by stating a problem with sleep and then presenting a solution
by sharing a cause-and-effect situation when sleep is interrupted
by explaining the steps to learning a new game
by comparing how long people dream at night

passage: pdfData:pdf/2025 NYS Grade 4 English Language Arts Test Released Questions.pdf
question_text: Which sentence best describes how the chart adds to the information in the article?
options: It explains how sleep helps keep the body healthy.
It shares the steps to fall asleep easily.
It offers facts about how the body reacts to sleep.
It compares being awake to being asleep.

passage: pdfData:pdf/2025 NYS Grade 4 English Language Arts Test Released Questions.pdf
question_text: How does the author organize the information in paragraphs 5 through 10?
options: by comparing each item that Dustin pulls out of the wallet
by giving the reasons why Dustin must search for the wallet's owner
by listing the order of events that lead to Dustin finding the wallet
by showing how the clues cause Dustin to find the wallet's owner

passage: pdfData:pdf/2025 NYS Grade 4 English Language Arts Test Released Questions.pdf
question_text: What do the details in paragraph 13 reveal about Salvador?
options: His belongings often get lost on the train.
He enjoys visiting the city where Dustin lives.
He is grateful for Dustin's act of kindness.
His family is very important to him.

passage: pdfData:pdf/2025 NYS Grade 4 English Language Arts Test Released Questions.pdf
question_text: Which statement best explains why Dustin claims, "This has been the best adventure ever!" in paragraph 17?
options: Dustin's actions lead to an invitation to Rocket Land with Salvador's family.
Marisa is proud and makes Dustin's favorite cake to celebrate.
Dustin has made the day pass quickly by searching for the owner of the wallet.
Salvador's wallet has many clues to help Dustin solve the mystery.

passage: pdfData:pdf/2025 NYS Grade 4 English Language Arts Test Released Questions.pdf
question_text: What does the word "approval" suggest as used in paragraph 25?
options: Everyone is ready to leave for Rocket Land.
Dustin is allowed to sit with Hugo and Carlos.
The boys may eat the snacks Emerita has baked.
The blue van will take everyone to Rocket Land.

passage: pdfData:pdf/2025 NYS Grade 4 English Language Arts Test Released Questions.pdf
question_text: Which sentence best states a theme of the story?
options: The best mysteries are solved using teamwork.
People in different cities can have a lot in common.
Helping others can bring surprising rewards.
Pets are important for bringing families together.

passage: pdfData:pdf/2025 NYS Grade 4 English Language Arts Test Released Questions.pdf
question_text: What do the details in paragraphs 14 and 16 show about Dustin's mother? Use two details from the story to support your response.

passage: pdfData:pdf/2025 NYS Grade 4 English Language Arts Test Released Questions.pdf
question_text: Many people believe that it is important to do the right thing even if no one is watching. How do Dustin's actions in the story support this idea? Use two details from the story to support your response.

passage: pdfData:pdf/2025 NYS Grade 4 English Language Arts Test Released Questions.pdf
question_text: How is paragraph 3 organized in the story?
options: by making comparisons between two characters
by telling the solution to a problem
by giving the answer to a question
by describing events in the order they happen

passage: pdfData:pdf/2025 NYS Grade 4 English Language Arts Test Released Questions.pdf
question_text:
Read this sentence from paragraph 6.
I rattled her courtyard fence and called, "Are you there?"
What does the word "rattled" mean as used in this sentence?
options: made someone feel excited
noticed a door or a gate
walked around to wait for someone
made a noise by moving something

passage: pdfData:pdf/2025 NYS Grade 4 English Language Arts Test Released Questions.pdf
question_text: What do Miss Sabines' actions in paragraph 8 reveal most about her?
options: She cares about the narrator.
She thinks the narrator is funny.
She is a very curious person.
She likes when people visit her.

passage: pdfData:pdf/2025 NYS Grade 4 English Language Arts Test Released Questions.pdf
question_text: Which sentence from the story best describes the setting?
options: "Even so, I enjoyed making the steep but quick (ten-minute) climb to Miss Sabines' house." (paragraph 2)

"It has a big garden, with beautiful desert plants and herbs growing everywhere, and a courtyard that has tiles painted bright colors, with sculptures, pinwheels, wind chimes, and lawn ornaments scattered throughout." (paragraph 5)
"The pleasant voice came floating across the courtyard walls, putting me instantly at ease." (paragraph 7)

"Miss Sabines showed me some of her new plantings, we played with her pets, and I leafed through a collection of photographs by Ansel Adams, whom Miss Sabines calls a 'poet of Southwestern landscapes.'" (paragraph 11)

passage: pdfData:pdf/2025 NYS Grade 4 English Language Arts Test Released Questions.pdf
question_text: Sometimes a place can be special to a person. Which detail best shows how this idea is developed in the story?
options: "The sun was turning the Sangre de Cristo Mountains a rosy gold color." (paragraph 1)
"Speaking of daydreams, I often fantasize about living in a house like Miss Sabines." (paragraph 5)
"We passed the rest of the afternoon puttering around the house." (paragraph 11)
"'We're having a party tonight, and I've been gone for hours!'" (paragraph 12)

passage: pdfData:pdf/2025 NYS Grade 4 English Language Arts Test Released Questions.pdf
question_text: Which sentence best states a theme of the story?
options: It is important for people to not waste their time.
Hard work always pays off in the end.
Friends can help us feel better when we are upset.
It is important to respect your elders.

passage: pdfData:pdf/2025 NYS Grade 4 English Language Arts Test Released Questions.pdf
question_text:
Read this sentence from paragraph 3 of Marie Callender: Homemade Pie Maven.
The demand for Callender's pies continued to grow.
What does the author mean by the word "demand" as used in this sentence? Use two details from the article to support your response.

question_text: In Marie Callender: Homemade Pie Maven, how does the organization of the article help the reader understand the events? Use two details from the article to support your response.

passage: pdfData:pdf/2025 NYS Grade 4 English Language Arts Test Released Questions.pdf
question_text: In A Wedding-Cake Tale, how do Able's actions in paragraphs 4 through 6 support a theme about being a good friend? Use two details from the story to support your response.

passage: pdfData:pdf/2025 NYS Grade 4 English Language Arts Test Released Questions.pdf
question_text: In Marie Callender: Homemade Pie Maven, what is a goal that Callender tries to reach? In A Wedding-Cake Tale, what is a goal that Able tries to reach? How do Callender and Able work to reach their goals? Use details from both the article and the story to support your response.
